snippet: California's ban on the sale of semiautomatic assault weapons, enacted after five children were shot to death in a Stockton schoolyard in 1989, was upheld Friday by a Federal appeals court.    The ruling, issued by a unanimous three-judge panel of...
lead_paragraph: California's ban on the sale of semiautomatic assault weapons, enacted after five children were shot to death in a Stockton schoolyard in 1989, was upheld Friday by a Federal appeals court. The ruling, issued by a unanimous three-judge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, rejected arguments by the National Rifle Association that the law, the first of its kind in the nation, violates the constitutional right to bear arms.
